intro: Selago tenuis, commonly known as narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Selago tenuis plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub ecosystems.
